text: Sidi Maaouia Mosque (), was a Tunisian mosque located in the north of the medina of Tunis. It does not exist anymore.Mohamed Belkhodja, Tārīkh maʻālim al-tawḥīd fī al-qadīm wa-fī al-Jadīd, Tunis, al-Maṭbaʻah al-Tūnisīyah, 1939, 429 p == Localization== The mosque was located in El Monastiri Street. == Etymology== It got its name from a saint, Sidi Maaouia, a cap Bon native. == History== The mosque had its own Habous for the Hadith recital during Ramadan. Nowadays, it is replaced by a private house. == References == Category:Mosques in Tunis
title: Sidi Maaouia Mosque
